newsitem.title: USA: Novell's Marengi to join Dell.
newsitem.headline: Novell's Marengi to join Dell.

text.p: Dell Computer Corp. said Monday that outgoing Novell Inc. President Joseph Marengi will join Dell to handle development of large corporate customers and other business clients.

Marengi, whose resignation as president and chief operating officer of Novell was announced June 6, will join Dell as senior vice president of the relationship group, the company said in a press release. Marengi leaves Novell on June 30.

Marengi joined Novell in 1989 and has served as its president since September 1996. He had been considered a contender for Novell's top job following the departure last August of Chief Executive Bob Frankenberg. But the job went to Eric Schmidt, former chief technology officer of Sun Microsystems Inc.
Marengi's resignation was announced a week after Novell said it would lay off 1,000 workers -- about 18 percent of its work force -- after a slump in sales of its computer networking software.

Marengi joins Dell as it initiates plans to broaden its offerings to large and mid-sized businesses through such new products as workstations and such new services as expanded factory integration of software, Dell said.
